content: diamonds for baby cardigan size 3-6 months one size only ©vraja leader - @tiemeinknits diamonds for baby cardigan page 1 of 9 notes this baby cardigan is worked in one piece from the top down in a classic raglan design using short row wrap and turn method to shape the neck sleeves are worked in the round i designed this cardigan as a fun way to use yarn left over from other projects it uses small amounts of 7 different colours the yarn i have used is similar to a sport weight but you could substitute 4-ply/fingering just check your gauge as the instructions are given by row count rather than by measurement the gauge swatch should be square if your gauge swatch is a smaller or larger square than mine the cardigan will still turn out fine but the finished size will be affected yarn hobbii soft bamboo double 50g = 115m in the following colours purple 75m curry 115m white 75m blue 8m azur blue 25m burgundy 8m yellow 25m *please note that these are the amounts of each colour needed for the cardigan it doesn t include your gauge swatch which will require approx 30m of yarn materials 2 5mm 3mm needles for working in the round for the sleeves dpns or circular 2 5mm 3mm needles for working flat for the body yarn holders or scrap yarn for holding sleeve stitches stitch markers 5 buttons - i used 15mm buttons it s best to check size after knitting is complete gauge using 3mm needles 27sts x 38 row = 10cm x 10cm in stocking stitch key k knit p purl sts stitches rs right side ws wrong side sl1 slip one pm place marker m marker m1r make 1 right m1l make 1 left slm slip marker w&t wrap and turn ssk slip slip knit round s round s ©vraja leader - @tiemeinknits diamonds for baby cardigan page 2 of 9 buttonhole instructions buttonholes are made using the one-row buttonhole method follow these steps when the pattern says to make a buttonhole 1 yarn to front sl1 purlwise yarn back fig 1 2 sl1 purlwise and pass previous stitch over repeat a total of 3 times fig 2 3 slip last stitch on right needle to left needle turn work yarn back fig 3 4 cast on 3 sts using cable cast on method cast on 4th stitch bring yarn forward after making stitch but before placing on left needle fig 4 turn work 5 sl1 knitwise and pass last cast on stitch over it then continue the row as indicated in the pattern fig 5 6 finished buttonhole fig 6 fig 1 fig 2 fig 3 fig 4 fig 5 fig 6 *note girls and boys cardigans are buttoned on opposite sides for a girl buttonholes are made at the end of a row you will begin buttonhole instructions when you are nearing the end of a buttonhole row with 7 sts remaining for a
